title: Sammy Onyango
text:
Sammy Onyango (3 March 1961 – 2 August 2002) was a <a href="Kenya%20national%20football%20team">Kenya international</a> <a href="Association%20football">football</a> winger who played club football in <a href="Kenya">Kenya</a>.
Club career.
Born in <a href="Migori%20District">Migori District</a>, Onyango began playing football in the <a href="Kenyan%20Premier%20League">Kenyan Premier League</a> with Hakati Sportiff in 1980 before joining <a href="Gor%20Mahia%20F.C.">Gor Mahia F.C.</a> at age 20 in 1981.
Onyango helped Gor Mahia win a domestic league and cup double, and its first and only <a href="African%20Cup%20Winners%27%20Cup">African Cup Winners' Cup</a> title in 1987. He is Gor Mahia's top all-time scorer in all competitions as well as in the league with a total of 92 goals including 79 league goals. In 1990, he joined <a href="Kisumu%20Telkom">Kisumu Posta</a>, the club he would finish his playing career with in the 1994.
International career.
Onyango made several appearances for the <a href="Kenya%20national%20football%20team">Kenya national football team</a>, including six <a href="FIFA%20World%20Cup">FIFA World Cup</a> qualifying matches. He played for Kenya at the <a href="1988%20African%20Cup%20of%20Nations">1988</a> and <a href="1990%20African%20Cup%20of%20Nations">1990 African Cup of Nations</a> finals. He also won a silver medal with Kenya at the <a href="Football%20at%20the%201987%20All-Africa%20Games">1987 All-Africa Games</a> in <a href="Nairobi">Nairobi</a>.
Personal.
Onyango died in a traffic accident in <a href="Kisumu">Kisumu</a> on 2 August 2002.
